register.description: IP Revision Identifier (X.Y.R) Used by software to track features, bugs, and compatibility

bitfield.description: IP Revision

register.description: SYSTEM CONFIGURATION REGISTER This register is the OCP-socket system configuration register.

bitfield.description: Sets the behavior of the master port power management signals.

bitenum.description: Force-standby. MStandby is only asserted when the module is disabled.
Smart-standby: MStandby is asserted based on the activity of the module. The module will try to go to standby during the vertical blanking period.

bitfield.description: Software reset. Set the bit to 1 to trigger a module reset. The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. During reads return 0.

bitenum.description: The module is reset Note: Before setting the software reset bit to 1 in register, the user must have access to a CSI2 receiver register.

bitfield.description: Internal OCP gating strategy

bitenum.description: Automatic OCP clock gating strategy is applied based on the OCP interface activity.

register.description: SYSTEM STATUS REGISTER This register provides status information about the module, excluding the interrupt status register.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
Internal reset monitoring

bitenum.description: Internal module reset is on going.

register.description: INTERRUPT STATUS REGISTER - All contexts This register associates one bit for each context in order to determine which context has generated the interrupt. The context must be enabled for events to be generated on that context. If the context is disabled, the interrupt is not generated.

READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: ECC has been used to do the correction of the only 1-bit error status (short packet only).

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: ECC error status (short and long packets). No correction of the header because of more than 1-bit error.

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

register.description: GLOBAL CONTROL REGISTER This register controls the CSI2 RECEIVER module. This register must not be modified dynamically (except IF_EN bit field).

bitfield.description: Controls the pixel clock sent to the BYS output port
Sets the DMA burst size on the L3 interconnect.

bitenum.description: Use the burst size defined in the BURST_SIZE register

bitfield.description: VP clock enable.
Read returns reset value
Not posted writes
Controls autogating of the PWRSCP clock

bitenum.description: PWRSCP clock is automatically cut when it isn't needed.

bitfield.description: VP only enable.

bitenum.description: The VP is enabled and the OCP master port is enabled.
The VP is enabled and the OCP master port is disabled.

bitfield.description: Indicates if 64-bit or 32-bit streaming burst is used. Valid only if CSI2_CTRL.STREAMING=1

bitenum.description: 64-bit streaming burst is used; byte enable pattern is 0xFF
32-bit streaming burst is used; byte enable pattern is 0x0F

bitfield.description: VP_PCLK control. Sets the VP_PCLK as a function of the ISS interconnect interface clock (OCPCLK).

bitenum.description: Division by 3: VP_PCLK = OCPCLK / 3. Example scenarios: - Low VP_PCLK, Memory -> VP: Same as typical memory -> VP, but VP_PCLK = OCPCLK/2 - Typical sensor -> VP: Autoidle enabled, FCLK at optimal rate, sensor provides DPCM compressed RAW12 data at 650 Mbps. Image timings VP_PCLK = (OCPCLK/2) and [31:15] FRACDIV = 0xD000 2600 active pixels/line, 128 blanking pixels, no vertical blanking. (This scenario corresponds to the OTF operation at maximum CCP2 speed.)

bitfield.description: Enables the debug mode.
Sets the DMA burst size on the L3 interconnect.
Select endianness for YUV4:2:2 8 bit and YUV4:2:0 legacy formats.

bitenum.description: Use native MIPI CSI2 endianness: Little endian for all formats except for YUV4:2:2 8b and YUV4:2:0 Legacy which a big endian.
Store all pixel formats little endian.

bitfield.description: Set the modality in which IF_EN works.

bitenum.description: If IF_EN = 0 the interface is disabled immediately.
If IF_EN = 1 the interface is disabled after all FEC sync code have been received for the active contexts.

bitfield.description: Enables the Error Correction Code check for the received header (short and long packets for all virtual channel ids).
Read returns reset value
Enables the physical interface to the module.

bitenum.description: The interface is disabled. If FRAME = 0, it is disabled immediately. If FRAME = 1, it is disabled when each context has received the FEC sync code.

The interface is enabled immediately, the data acquisition starts on the next FSC sync code. Writing 1 to this register when the current value is 0 has the effect to clear the output FIFO. The pixel data of the following frame will be written in the PING buffer, that is, the .PING_PONG bits are reset to 0 as well.

register.description: DEBUG REGISTER (Header) This register provides a way to debug the CSI2 RECEIVER module with no image sensor connected to the module. The debug mode is enabled by .DBG_EN. Only full 32-bit values must be written. The register is used to write short packets and header of long packets.

bitfield.description: 32-bit input value.

register.description: COMPLEXIO CONFIGURATION REGISTER for the complex I/O This register contains the lane configuration for the order and position of the lanes (clock and data) and the polarity order for the control of the PHY differential signals in addition to the control bit for the power FSM.

register.description: TIMING REGISTER This register controls the CSI2 RECEIVER module. This register must not be modified while .IF_EN is set to 1. It is used to indicate the number of L3 cycles for the Stop State monitoring.

bitfield.description: Read returns reset value
Read returns reset value
Read returns reset value
Read returns reset value
Control of ForceRxMode signal

bitenum.description: Deassertion of ForceRxMode. The hardware reset the bit at the end of the Force RX Mode assertion. The software can reset the bit in order to stop the assertion of the ForceRXMode signal prior to the completion of the period.

bitfield.description: Multiplication factor for the number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE_COUNTER bit field

bitenum.description: The number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE _COUNTER is multiplied by 1x
The number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE _COUNTER is multiplied by 16x

bitfield.description: Multiplication factor for the number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE_COUNTER bit field

bitenum.description: The number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE _COUNTER is multiplied by 1x
The number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE _COUNTER is multiplied by 4x

bitfield.description: Stop State counter for monitoring. It indicates the number of L3 to monitor for Stop State before deasserting ForceRxMode (complex I/O 1). The value is from 0 to 8191.

register.description: CONTROL REGISTER - Context This register controls the Context. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code.

bitfield.description: Allows swapping bytes two by two in the payload data. It does not affect: - short packets - long packet header or footers - CRC calculation The purpose is to by swap data send to the OCP port and/or video port
Enables the generic mode.

bitenum.description: Disabled. Data is received according to .FORMAT and the long packet code transmitted in the MIPI stream is used.
Enabled. Data is received according to .FORMAT and the long packet code transmitted in the MIPI stream is ignored.

bitfield.description: Controls BYS port. Must be 0 when TRANSCODE=0

bitenum.description: Disabled. Data from the HSCALER is forwarded to the video port and/or OCP port
Enabled Data from the HSCALER is send to the BYS output port. Data received on the BYS input port is forwarded to the video port and/or OCP port

bitfield.description: Enable horizontal downscaling by a factor of two. Applies to RAW data when transcoding is enabled. Must be disabled when transcoding is disabled. 0x0: Disable 0x1: Enable

Enables image transcoding. When this features is enabled: - the data format from the camera is defined by the FORMAT register - the format after transcode is defined by the TRANSCODE register. The memory storage / video port formats is defined by the TRANSCODE register

bitenum.description: Outputs uncompressed RAW10 data. Data in memory is organized as regular packed RAW10 data
Outputs DPCM compressed RAW10 data. After compression, pixels are coded on 8 bits. Data in memory is organized as regular RAW8 data
Outputs uncompressed RAW12 data. Data in memory is organized as regular RAW12+EXP16 data
Outputs DPCM compressed RAW12 data. After compression, pixels are coded on 8 bits. Data in memory is organized as regular RAW8 data
Outputs uncompressed RAW12 data. Data in memory is organized as regular packed RAW12 data
Outputs uncompressed RAW8 data. Data in memory is organized as regular RAW8 data
Outputs uncompressed RAW10 data. Data in memory is organized as regular RAW10+EXP16 data
Outputs A-Law compressed RAW10 data. After compression, pixels are coded on 8 bits. Data in memory is organized as regular RAW8 data.

bitfield.description: Number of FEC to receive between using swap ofCSI2_CTX_DAT_PING_ADDR_i and CSI2_CTX_DAT_PONG_ADDR_i for the calculation of the address in memory (must be used only in interlace mode, otherwise set to 1).

Sets the number of frame to acquire. Once the frame acquisition starts, the COUNT value is decremented after every frame. When COUNT reaches 0, the FRAME_NUMBER_IRQ interrupt is triggered and CTX_EN bit is set to 0. Writes to this bit field are controlled by the COUNT_UNLOCK bit. During the same OCP write access, the bit field COUNT_UNLOCK must be written in addition to COUNT bit field in order to change the COUNT value. COUNT can be overwritten dynamically with a new count value. 0: Infinite number of frames (no count). 1: 1 frame to acquire ... 255: 255 frames to acquire
Indicates if the end of frame signal must be asserted at the end of the line.

bitenum.description: The end of frame signal is asserted at the end of each frame.
The end of frame signal is not asserted at the end of each frame.

bitfield.description: Indicates if the end of line signal must be asserted at the end of the line.

bitenum.description: The end of line signal is asserted at the end of each frame.
The end of line signal is not asserted at the end of each frame.

bitfield.description: Enables the checksum check for the received payload (long packet only).
Unlock writes to the COUNT bit field.

bitenum.description: COUNT bit field is locked. Writes have no effect
COUNT bit field is unlocked. Writes are possible.

bitfield.description: Indicates whether the PING or PONG destination address (CSI2_CTX_DAT_PING_ADDR_i or CSI2_CTX_DAT_PONG_ADDR_i) was used to write the last frame. This bit field toggles after every FEC_NUMBER FEC sync code received for the current context.

Forces sending of the data to both VPORT and OCP. Only applies to formats that existing in two versions: - One sending data to OCP port only - One sending data to VPORT only (tagged with the +VP extension) The format version sending data only to OCP should be chosen. When VP_FORCE is set, the data is sent to video port and to OCP port, no matter is format +VP or not (RAW8 + DPCM10 + VP or RAW8 + DPCM10 + EXP16). If this bit is cleared, data is only sent to one destination, so if the format is RAW8 + DPCM10 + VP, the data will be sent only to video port and if the format is RAW8 + DPCM10 + EXP16, the data will be sent only to OCP port. If CSI2_CTRL[11] VP_ONLY_EN bit is set, no data will be send to the OCP port although VP_FORCE is set.
Line modulo configuration

bitenum.description: .LINE_NUMBER is used once per frame for the generation of the LINE_NUMBER_IRQ.
.LINE_NUMBER is used as a modulo number for the generation of the LINE_NUMBER_IRQ (multiple times the interrupt can be generated for each frame)

bitfield.description: Enables the context

Outputs DPCM compressed RAW10 data. After compression, pixels are coded on 8 bits. Data in memory is organized as regular RAW8 data

bitfield.description: Number of FEC to receive between using swap ofCSI2_CTX_DAT_PING_ADDR_i and CSI2_CTX_DAT_PONG_ADDR_i for the calculation of the address in memory (must be used only in interlace mode, otherwise set to 1).

Sets the number of frame to acquire. Once the frame acquisition starts, the COUNT value is decremented after every frame. When COUNT reaches 0, the FRAME_NUMBER_IRQ interrupt is triggered and CTX_EN bit is set to 0. Writes to this bit field are controlled by the COUNT_UNLOCK bit. During the same OCP write access, the bit field COUNT_UNLOCK must be written in addition to COUNT bit field in order to change the COUNT value. COUNT can be overwritten dynamically with a new count value. 0: Infinite number of frames (no count). 1: 1 frame to acquire ... 255: 255 frames to acquire
Indicates if the end of frame signal must be asserted at the end of the line.

bitfield.description: Indicates if the end of line signal must be asserted at the end of the line.

bitenum.description: COUNT bit field is locked. Writes have no effect

bitfield.description: Indicates whether the PING or PONG destination address (CSI2_CTX_DAT_PING_ADDR_i or CSI2_CTX_DAT_PONG_ADDR_i) was used to write the last frame. This bit field toggles after every FEC_NUMBER FEC sync code received for the current context.

Forces sending of the data to both VPORT and OCP. Only applies to formats that existing in two versions: - One sending data to OCP port only - One sending data to VPORT only (tagged with the +VP extension) The format version sending data only to OCP should be chosen. When VP_FORCE is set, the data is sent to video port and to OCP port, no matter is format +VP or not (RAW8 + DPCM10 + VP or RAW8 + DPCM10 + EXP16). If this bit is cleared, data is only sent to one destination, so if the format is RAW8 + DPCM10 + VP, the data will be sent only to video port and if the format is RAW8 + DPCM10 + EXP16, the data will be sent only to OCP port. If CSI2_CTRL[11] VP_ONLY_EN bit is set, no data will be send to the OCP port although VP_FORCE is set.

The end of frame signal is not asserted at the end of each frame.

bitfield.description: Indicates if the end of line signal must be asserted at the end of the line.

bitenum.description: The end of line signal is asserted at the end of each frame.
The end of line signal is not asserted at the end of each frame.

bitfield.description: Enables the checksum check for the received payload (long packet only).
Unlock writes to the COUNT bit field.

bitenum.description: COUNT bit field is locked. Writes have no effect
COUNT bit field is unlocked. Writes are possible.

bitfield.description: Indicates whether the PING or PONG destination address (CSI2_CTX_DAT_PING_ADDR_i or CSI2_CTX_DAT_PONG_ADDR_i) was used to write the last frame. This bit field toggles after every FEC_NUMBER FEC sync code received for the current context.

Forces sending of the data to both VPORT and OCP. Only applies to formats that existing in two versions: - One sending data to OCP port only - One sending data to VPORT only (tagged with the +VP extension) The format version sending data only to OCP should be chosen. When VP_FORCE is set, the data is sent to video port and to OCP port, no matter is format +VP or not (RAW8 + DPCM10 + VP or RAW8 + DPCM10 + EXP16). If this bit is cleared, data is only sent to one destination, so if the format is RAW8 + DPCM10 + VP, the data will be sent only to video port and if the format is RAW8 + DPCM10 + EXP16, the data will be sent only to OCP port. If CSI2_CTRL[11] VP_ONLY_EN bit is set, no data will be send to the OCP port although VP_FORCE is set.
Line modulo configuration

bitenum.description: .LINE_NUMBER is used once per frame for the generation of the LINE_NUMBER_IRQ.
.LINE_NUMBER is used as a modulo number for the generation of the LINE_NUMBER_IRQ (multiple times the interrupt can be generated for each frame)

bitfield.description: Enables the context

register.description: CONTROL REGISTER - Context This register controls the Context. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code (except for VIRTUAL_ID and FORMAT fields). The change of VIRTUIAL_ID and FORMAT has to occur only when the context is disabled (.CTX_EN).

bitfield.description: Frame number The CSI-2 protocol engine extracts the frame number from the SOF short packet sent by the camera.
Selects the pixel format of USER_DEFINED in FORMAT

bitenum.description: RAW8 (not valid if FORMAT is USER_DEFINED_8_BIT_DATA_TYPE_x_EXP8 with x from 1 to 8)

bitfield.description: Virtual channel ID
Selects the DPCM predictor.

bitenum.description: The advanced predictor is used. Not supported for 10- 8- 10 algorithm. Performance limited to 1 pixel/cycle.

bitfield.description: Data format selection.

bitenum.description: Same as YUV4:2:2 8bit + VP but data is send as 16-bit wide words to video port. Could be used together with the GENERIC and BYTESWAP features.

register.description: DATA MEM ADDRESS OFFSET REGISTER - Context This register sets the offset, which is applied on the destination address after each line is written to memory. This register applies for both and . For example, it enables to perform 2D data transfers of the pixel data into a frame buffer. In such case, the pixel data and frame buffer data must have the same data format. The 5 LSBs are ignored: the offset must be a multiple of 32 bytes. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code. Only full 32-bit values must be written.

bitfield.description: Line offset programmed in bytes (signed value 2's complement). If OFST = 0, the data is written contiguously in memory. Otherwise, OFST sets the destination offset between the first pixel of the previous line and the first pixel of the current line. Valid range: - 2 ÷ (2 - 1)

register.description: DATA MEM PING ADDRESS REGISTER - Context This register sets the 32-bit memory address where the pixel data are stored. The destination is double buffered: this register sets the PING address. Double buffering is enabled when the addresses and are different. The 5 LSBs are ignored: the address must be aligned on a 32-byte boundary. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code. Only full 32-bit values must be written.

bitfield.description: 27 most-significant bits of the 32-bit address.

register.description: CONTROL REGISTER - Context This register controls the Context. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code.

bitfield.description: When bit fieldCSI2_CTX_CTRL1_i[27:24] TRANSCODE = 0 Alpha value for RGB888, RGB666 and RBG444. When bit fields CSI2_CTX_CTRL1_i[27:24] TRANSCODE = 1 and [29] BYS=1 Image width, in pixels, acquired from the BYS port.
Line number for the interrupt generation
